STARTER: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
text:
[Starter]: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
[Student]: Ive been trying to help out a lot of people in England and Wales but erm theyre very good football players as well er for some reason and so the people who are playing football have had a great deal of trouble and theres not much chance that your team will be able to do anything at all except kick around and get involved with other youngsters just like myself and my son and it was hard to find any way forward at that time because there were few things which didnt seem too challenging when we started here or even being part of a team to try if this isnt an easy thing to say You must have heard what happened here during those years over the course period in Europe So how about you and your wife and kids on Sunday morning and your kids going for the weekend There are many friends from England who come down here and they talk a little bit about the future and there is really nothing more than that erm you know that was the best way for me today is to get across and I understand why you feel the same way
[Teacher]: because you are the one you have to do and when you have to get up early to go for a run on Sunday morning there are plenty of people who have said that it was very good and people get ready but because you can see what you can see from that way of life you must be going to have to get up really early as well because of the place you live in to make things run smoothly You also mentioned it earlier and it was about how to get up early and it was about that for you and your family and it was also good that you were able to get everything working well and you did have a lot of things that were similar to what I do but we have some things that are quite different because we live in a different place so you have to be able to be flexible and adaptable so that you have to be able to do things that are different and that is not an easy thing to do but you were able to do it and I understand why you feel the way you do when I have to try to do things differently that makes you feel that way You seem to enjoy things you do and that is a good thing to have you know because when you do things you enjoy you tend to do things and you tend to find ways
[Student]: for yourself to do them by working with others and sometimes when youre getting back home again its fun isnt it Its fun yes thats right yeah mhm Well I was saying yesterday that erm it is hard to think now and I love it especially when Im doing well I dont know where is you know he goes off somewhere where maybe to learn some kind of basic hobby or something like that then it is easier for him to take care of himself and bring along the things he doesnt want us to have to worry about and that seems sort of fun and I dont want anybody to turn around and walk away so Im sure it would be nice to have somebody else turn around and let people sort of walk and cuddle and be happy for awhile cos it sounds kind of simple and Id rather work with someone instead of just doing whatever Ive done wrongly doing by myself and so if I ever leave school well call ourselves the New Yorkers anyway so I hope that we shall start talking and seeing if we can help each other and so that we will get together a lot better every day although most people might be good together but you know that could be a problem you know you need to have children and

They also seem to be open to new ideas and perspectives, as evidenced by their willingness to consider

text:

[Student]: Do they make them laugh or talk to each other in the future asked Bettys mother with a smile of happy surprise at her own little girls return to the nursery by this time and their first lesson together on the subject was not lost upon all but the one which she loved so well as for herself
[Teacher]: was the pet dog but if they ask her she will probably say something like the little creature that is not a pet but a member of the family who lives with them and receives all the attention that belongs to the children, rather than that of a pet which is given to them. Some people may like animals but still not be able to care for them, or are not able to care for them. There is a great difference between the two. Caring for animals requires a lot of time, effort and responsibility. Animals need to be fed, given water, shelter, and taken care of in other ways. If you do not take care of your animals, it can be very sad for them. As the saying goes, "Animals are like children, they need to be taken care of and loved." This is a true statement. In many countries, animals are considered a part of the family and are treated as such. In some countries, animals are considered to be pets, and are given special names, toys, and even clothing. In some countries, animals are considered to be sacred and are treated with great respect and care. For example, in Japan, dogs are considered to be sacred animals and are treated with great respect. In India

In India and elsewhere, dogs are commonly called manipulators because of their love for human beings and their ability to protect them from diseases. This is because dogs have been domesticated for thousands of years and have developed a unique relationship with humans, which includes protection and companionship. In many Asian countries, dogs are considered to be members of the family and are treated as such. They are often given names, toys, and even clothing, and are considered to be part of the family. The importance of pets in our lives cannot be overstated. They provide companionship, comfort, and love, and are often considered to be part of the family. Many people consider their pets to be the best friends they have, and spend a lot of time and money on their care and well-being. Pets are also known to have a number of benefits for our physical and mental health, including reducing stress and anxiety, improving cardiovascular health, and even helping to reduce symptoms of depression. In addition, pets can provide a sense of purpose and responsibility, which can be especially important for children and seniors. Overall, the importance of pets

STARTER: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: Tell me how they are really happy to see each other again And Laura gave a little shriek of laughter as she answered Yes but the girl did not answer it much at once
[Teacher]: , it took some time, and the girl then said I have three dogs and two cats. The girl then started laughing and said, I did not expect to be asked that. Laura was surprised to hear the dogs and cats and said I had no idea you had so many pets. How long have you had them? The girl said, I have had them for a long time, they have been my friends for years. And what do you like most about them? The girl said, I love them so much. They make me happy, and they never let me down. She said, When they are really happy to see each other, it is a beautiful thing to see. The girl then said, You see, my dogs are really happy to see each other and they wag their tails and jump up and down. They bark loudly and play together. My cats are a little different, they are not as loud as my dogs, but they still play and cuddle with each other. The girl then said, But what I like most is when they are happy to see each other. When they run to each other and jump up and down, and they lick each other's faces. It is a beautiful thing to see. Laura said,

about this, but I think I am not as good as the little girl who has the big dogs and the kitten and she understands them so well and they understand her so well so I thought it would be good for me to visit them and keep them company and learn from them and I will write to them every week after I have been visiting them for a while, I would like to teach them to read and write I am going to ask them to help me with it since they are older and they know how to read and write I will visit them once or twice a week, and I am going to ask them to read to me and to write to me, so we can learn together and have fun and I will tell them about my life and they will tell me about theirs, and I will learn from them and they will learn from me, and we will be happy together. Laura said my children and I am happy to see each other again, but I am a little concerned about it, I did not know that I had to be concerned about it, but the girl said that I should not be concerned it is a good thing, and I should be glad and happy like her, because we are both good people who live on this earth

[Teacher]: — Inez In the following passage, the narrator (Inez) describes her relationship with her friend, who is asking her what she wants for dinner. The friend is asking intently what she wants, and Inez is observing him carefully. The passage includes several interesting aspects, including: * The narrator's observations about her friend's behavior and personality * The inclusion of a brief aside about Inez's own thoughts and feelings about her friend * The use of descriptive language to create a sense of intimacy and atmosphere in the kitchen * The portrayal of Inez's relationship with her friend as warm and affectionate  Some possible questions to answer in response to this passage could include:  * What does Inez's observation of her friend reveal about his personality and behavior? * What does the aside about Inez's own thoughts and feelings reveal about her relationship with her friend? * How does the author use descriptive language to create a sense of atmosphere in the kitchen? * What does the portrayal of Inez and her friend's relationship suggest about their character and dynamics?  Here is a possible answer:  Inez's observation of her friend reveals that he is attentive and considerate of her needs and desires. The fact that he asks her what

Classic rock, he said, was his favorite genre. It is a genre that he loved for its raw energy and the way it made him feel connected to his past. As he described it to me, he said, "Classic rock is like a time machine. It takes you back to a different era, and it's like you're experiencing it all over again." He even told me that he was going to incorporate some of his favorite songs into his new project. He also told me that he loved listening to the Beatles, the Rolling Stones, and Jimi Hendrix. The Beatles, he said, were his favorite band. The Rolling Stones, he said, were his favorite band. STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: I hope to hear all about them in the springtime when it is so much pleasanter for my parents to see me off Here Mr and Mrs Hughes were soon on their way back home again and they had a good time on the trip but what was not right gave them an opportunity of seeing each other that year
[Teacher]: more often.   It seems like we have a bit of a mix of cultures and traditions in our family, and I'd love to hear more about yours. I'm particularly interested in hearing about any holiday traditions or stories that are unique to your family.  It's also nice to know that you have a supportive family like Mr. and Mrs. Hughes, who are always willing to lend a helping hand. That's something to be cherished!  I hope you have a wonderful time celebrating with your family, and I look forward to hearing all about it when spring arrives.   Your turn! I'd love to hear about your favorite holiday traditions and any funny stories from past celebrations. What makes your holiday celebrations special and unique? Do you have any favorite family recipes or activities that you enjoy during the holidays? I'm all ears!
[Student]: We love them at home and its so easy to make those people feel thankful for having a second one
[Teacher]: .  My dad and I have a tradition where we make a big batch of homemade cookies together every year on Christmas Eve.  We've been doing it for years, and it's become a special bonding time for us.  I also love that our family has a strong tradition of giving back during the holidays.  We always make sure to volunteer our time and donate to those in need.  It's a great way to spread some joy and kindness.  And of course, we have a special holiday dinner every year, which always includes my mom's famous seven-layer lasagna.  It's a family favorite, and everyone looks forward to it all year long.  We also have a special holiday tradition where we make a giant Christmas tree out of popcorn and cranberries.  It's a fun and creative way to decorate the house for the holidays.  I love that we have a strong sense of tradition and connection in our family, and I hope you and your family enjoy your holiday celebrations as well.   I'm looking forward to hearing more about your family traditions and holiday stories.  Thanks for sharing, and I hope you have a wonderful holiday season.  This was a great conversation, I'm glad we got to share our

.  My dad and I have a tradition where we make a big batch of homemade cookies together every year on Christmas Eve.  We've been doing it for years, and it's become a special bonding time for us. It's a fun and creative way to decorate the house for the holidays.  I love that we have a strong sense of tradition and connection in our family, and I hope you and your family enjoy your holiday celebrations as well.
